qas.question: How many congressional districts are there in the city?
How many congressional districts were there at the peak population?
When was the last major Republican representation of a large part of the city?
Who was the last Republican to be fairly competitive in the mayoral race?

context: Philadelphia once comprised <a1_0>six<a1_0/> congressional districts. However, as a result of the city's declining population, it now has only <a0_0>four<a0_0/>: the 1st district, represented by Bob Brady; the 2nd, represented by Chaka Fattah; the 8th, represented by <a2_0>Mike Fitzpatrick<a2_0/>; and the 13th, represented by Brendan Boyle. All but Fitzpatrick are Democrats. Although they are usually swamped by Democrats in city, state and national elections, Republicans still have some support in the area, primarily in the northeast. A Republican represented a significant portion of Philadelphia in the House as late as <a3_0>1983<a3_0/>, and <a4_0>Sam Katz<a4_0/> ran competitive mayoral races as the Republican nominee in both 1999 and 2003.
